data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Myrcella,

 

Here are a couple of links that appear to be what you are looking for:

 

http://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5668107079.html

 

http://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5748828285.html

 

Good luck!

 

Best,

Henry Howard

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:01 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi!
 
There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?
 
Thank you, 
 
Myrcella

Myrcella,

It appears that the weather forecast around Alsea Falls this weekend (9/10 and 9/11) will be reasonably warm and mostly sunny.  I long sleeved shirt may be desirable for Sunday and sunscreen is advised if you burn easily.  Have fun!

 

Best,

Henry Howard

 

Search Results

Sat



80°

49°

Sun



71°

45°

 

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:08 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hello Henry,
 
I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!
 
Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  
 
Thank you, 
 
Myrcella

Mycella,

 

Here are a couple of delicious recipes that I found online:

 

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/11679/homemade-mac-and-cheese/

 

http://allrecipes.com/recipe/233603/bacon-wrapped-jalapeno-poppers/

 

http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/ree-drummond/classic-hot-wings-recipe.html

 

http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/alton-brown/guacamole-recipe.html

 

I hope your party goes well for you!

 

Best,

Henry Howard

 

From: Myrcella Baratheon [mailto:myrcella.baratheon@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:13 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Awesome recipes

 

 

Hello Henry,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Henry,




Good taste!





Myrcella

	http://www.foodnetwork.com/recipes/alton-brown/guacamole-recipe.html

	 

	I hope your party goes well for you!

	 

	Best,

	Henry Howard

	Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:13 PM
	To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu> <mailto:Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu> 
	Subject:  Awesome recipes

	I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

	 

	Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

	 

	Thank you, 

	 

	Myrcella

Hello Henry,
 
Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price!
 
Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.
 
Textbooks Needed:
Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273
 
Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3
 
Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!
 
Thanks!
Myrcella

Myrcella,

I was able to find good sources for the books that you are looking for.  Here are the links:

 

http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/linux-kernel-development-robert-love/1100508926?ean=9780672329463&pcta=n&st=PLA&sid=BNB_DRS_Core+Shopping+Textbooks_00000000&2sid=Google_&sourceId=PLGoP148&k_clickid=3x148

 

http://product.half.ebay.com/Engineering-Economic-Analysis-by-Ted-G-Eschenbach-Donald-G-Newnan-and-Jerome-P-Lavelle-2013-Hardcover/172519605&cpid=5000061065018

 

Best,

Henry Howard

Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:19 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Textbook help reminder!

 

Hello Henry,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price!

Thanks!

Myrcella

Hi, Henry ,
 
Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 
 
I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 
 
What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.
 
Thank you so much! 

Melisandre

Melisandre,

 

Here are a couple of good action drama television series with rankings:

 

Dexter (8.8/10)

Sons of Anarchy (8.4/10)

24 (8.4/10)

 

I hope you find one of these entertaining!

 

Best,

Henry

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 3:31 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Best TV Show to Watch

 

Hi, Henry ,

 

Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

 

I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

 

What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

 

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

Hi there!
 
I need to buy a gift for a friend.
 
My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.
She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).
I will need something that will get here on time.
Nothing that will take too long to ship please.
 
I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.
Please spend as close to that as you can.
 
Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.
 
Thank you,
Melisandre

Melisandre,

http://www.backcountry.com/basin-and-range-bonneville-fitness-short-womens?skid=BNG001U-BLA-XS&ti=UExQIFJ1bGUgQmFzZWQ6QmFja2NvdW50cnkgRXhjbHVzaXZlcyA6MToxMzo=

$29.97

 

I hope this helps.

 

Best,

HH

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 3:45 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Find a Gift for Someone

 

Hi there!

 

I need to buy a gift for a friend.

 

My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.

She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).

I will need something that will get here on time.

Nothing that will take too long to ship please.

 

I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.

Please spend as close to that as you can.

 

Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.

 

Thank you,

Melisandre

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Davos,

Apparently there are no interactions between diazepam and amphetamine.

https://www.drugs.com/drug-interactions/adderall-with-valium-190-1645-862-441.html

 

Despite this, your friend should TAKE ALL MEDICATIONS AS PRESCRIBED to avoid complications.  Amphetamine is an upper and diazepam is a benzodiazepine, so the effects of each drug may compete.

 

It would be good for your friend to avoid alcohol while taking valium.

http://www.webmd.com/drugs/2/drug-6306/diazepam-oral/details/list-interaction-food

Additionally, they should avoid driving after taking the valium until the effects have worn off.

 

I hope this helps.  I am not a doctor and I recommend that your friend obtains further clarification from an actual MD or pharmacist.  

 

Best,

HH

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 4:09 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  check on medication

You ARE the person to talk to. My friend is a heavy drinker, so this information is really helpful. I agree, though. I have to convince him to talk to his doctor.

 

Thanks for looking into this!

 

Davos

Hello Henry,

 

I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for. 

 

 

Here is the link for one job search site to get started. 

 

http://www.indeed.com 

 

Job criteria: 

 

You should find a computer engineering job. 

 

Must start after September 2016.

 

For now, just find one or more jobs you believe will work out well. We can talk about them further at our next meeting.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Davos

Davos,

 

Here are a couple of job postings of interest:

 

 

Software Development Engineer at AmazonCorporateLLC

https://us-amazon.icims.com/jobs/408203/software-development-engineer/job?iis=Job+Posting&iisn=Indeed+%28Paid+Sponsored+Posting%29&mobile=false&width=1260&height=1200&bga=true&needsRedirect=false&jan1offset=-480&jun1offset=-420

 

Software Development Engineer at Audible, Inc.

https://us-amazon.icims.com/jobs/387471/software-development-engineer/job?iis=Job+Posting&iisn=Indeed+%28Paid+Sponsored+Posting%29

 

Thanks for your concern and hope you hear from you soon.

 

Best,

HH

Hello Henry, 
 
I am your academic advisor. 
 
Below is a list of classes you must enroll in for Fall Term 2016 (yes, it’s actually still summer right now): 
 
ST 314 
PAC 201 
WR 121 
COMM 111 
H 100 
Note** Do not worry if there is no space in the class. I will make sure you get a spot in the class. 
 
In order to view the available times for these classes please use the OSU catalog <http://catalog.oregonstate.edu/Default.aspx?section=Course> . 
 
Please provide me with a list of the CRNs so that I can finish your registration process. 
Once you have been registered, I will provide you with the list of textbooks you will need for your classes. Since the textbook selection will be shared, we require all textbooks be acquired legally. 
 
Thank you, 
Professor Targaryen

Arya,

Here are the CRNs for the classes I’m interested in enrolling in:

 

ST314 – 50034 MWF 1200-1250

PAC201 – 37362 TR 800-850

WR 121 – 10099 MWF 900-950

COMM 111 – 17280 TR 1300-1350

H 100 – 20125 MWF 1100-1150

 

Thanks!

 

Best,

Henry Howard

 

 

 

From: Arya Targaryen [mailto:arya.targaryen@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 2:26 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Create an Ideal Class Schedule

 

Hello Henry, 

 

I am your academic advisor. 

 

Below is a list of classes you must enroll in for Fall Term 2016 (yes, it’s actually still summer right now): 

 

ST 314 

PAC 201 

WR 121 

COMM 111 

H 100 

Note** Do not worry if there is no space in the class. I will make sure you get a spot in the class.

Please provide me with a list of the CRNs so that I can finish your registration process. 

Once you have been registered, I will provide you with the list of textbooks you will need for your classes. Since the textbook selection will be shared, we require all textbooks be acquired legally. 

 

Thank you, 

Professor Targaryen

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Davos,

 

Here is a summary of the political climates for each location:

 

Istanbul, Turkey – travel warning, political turmoil, recent coup attempt, US embassy, questionable feelings towards Americans

https://travel.state.gov/content/passports/en/alertswarnings/turkey-travel-warning.html

 

Sofia, Bulgaria – appears to be alright (no government issued warning), US embassy, no war with US ally

 

Macedonia, Greece – appears to be alright (no government issued warning), US embassy, no war with US ally

 

Tirana, Albania – appears to be alright with warnings of potential petty crime, US embassy, no war with US ally

 

We may want to avoid traveling to Turkey at this point, due to the 90 day US government issued warning. Let me know if there are any other questions.

 

Best,

HH

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2016 3:51 PM
To: Howard, Henry <Henry.Howard@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  travel planning

Wow. I didn’t realize things were so bad. I guess we should talk through this at the next meeting. We may need to find a new travel destination for the next trip.

 

Thanks for digging up all this info!

 

Davos
